text: The 2016 Constitution Party presidential primaries were 2 electoral contests, held in the states of Idaho and Missouri, by the Constitution Party during the 2016 election season in order to allocate delegates from those states to the 2016 Constitution Party National Convention. ==Candidates== Candidates are sorted by delegate votes received at the 2016 Constitution Party National Convention. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" colspan="2" style="padding:10px; width:120px; " | Candidate ! rowspan="2" style="width:300px;" class="unsortable" | Profession ! rowspan="2" | State ! rowspan="2" class="unsortable" | Campaign ! rowspan="2" | Popular vote ! rowspan="2" | Contests won ! rowspan="2" | Delegates ! rowspan="2" class="unsortable" | Ref |- | data-sort-value="Darrell, Castle"|160x160px Darrell Castle|| style="background:#1F75FE;" | || Attorney Nominee for Vice President of the United States in 2008 |75px Tennessee |150px (Campaign • Website) Running mate: Scott Bradley |data-sort-value="0" | 0 |0 |184 | |- | data-sort- value="Copeland, Scott"|160x160px Scott Copeland|| style="background:#500080;"| || Minister Former Pastor |75px Texas | |data-sort-value="250" | 250 |1 |103.5 | |- | data-sort-value="Myers, J.R."|160x160px J.R. Myers|| style="background:#DA6A5E;"| || Chairman of the Constitution Party of Alaska |75px Alaska | |data-sort-value="138" | 138 |0 |9 | |- | data-sort-value="Ockander, Patrick Anthony"|160x160px Patrick Anthony Ockander|| style="background:#8AD2E1;"| || Author |75px Texas | |data-sort-value="95" | 95 |0 |0 | |} ==Results== === National === 800x800px === Idaho primary === The Constitution Party of Idaho held its primary on March 8. Election results, by county, of the 2016 Constitution presidential primary in Idaho {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:#F9F9F9; border:1px #aaa solid; border- collapse:collapse; font-size:95%;" |- style="background:#ddd;" ! colspan="4" |Idaho Constitution Party presidential primary, 2016 |- style="background:#f9f9;" ! rowspan="2" style="width:160px;" |Candidate ! colspan="2" style="width:75px;" |Popular vote ! rowspan="2" style="width:75px;" |Pledged delegates |- style="background:#f9f9f9;" !Count !Percentage |- align="right" | style="text-align:left;" |14x14px Scott Copeland |250 |51.7% |8 |- style="text-align:right;" | style="text- align:left;" |J.R. Myers |139 |28.7% |0 |- style="text-align:right; background:#e9e9e9;" | style="text-align:left;" |Patrick Anthony Ockander |95 |19.6% |0 |- style="text-align:right;" |Total: |484 |100% |8 |} {| border="0" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="2" |Key: | style="background:#e9e9e9;" |Withdrew prior to contest |} === Missouri primary === thumb|Election results, by county, of the 2016 Constitution presidential primary in Missouri The Constitution Party of Missouri held its primary on March 15. No candidate made it on the ballot, and the only option for voters was "Uncommitted". {| border="1" cellpadding="4" cellspacing="0" style="margin: 1em 1em 1em 0; background:#F9F9F9; border:1px #aaa solid; border-collapse:collapse; font- size:95%;" |- style="background:#ddd;" ! colspan="3" |Missouri Constitution Party presidential primary, 2016 |- style="background:#f9f9;" ! rowspan="2" style="width:160px;" |Candidate ! colspan="2" style="width:75px;" |Popular vote |- style="background:#f9f9f9;" !Count !Percentage |- align="right" | style="text-align:left;" |14x14px Uncommitted |691 |100% |- style="text- align:right;" |Total: |691 |100% |} ==See also== Presidential primaries * 2016 Democratic Party presidential primaries * 2016 Green Party presidential primaries * 2016 Libertarian Party presidential primaries * 2016 Republican Party presidential primaries ==References== Category:Constitution Party (United States) presidential primaries Constitution
